articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of a crowded district in the heart of Rafah on Wednesday during one of the most intense nights of bombardment of the southern Gaza city since Israel launched its offensive there this month.
articles.title: Israeli forces move deeper into Rafah in night of heavy battle

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Andreas Rinke, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: International Criminal Court Prosecutor Karim Khan's request for an arrest warrant against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has created a diplomatic quandary for some key member states: How to be supportive of both Israel and the ICC?
articles.title: Israel's allies grapple with bid for ICC warrant against Netanyahu

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader led prayers in Tehran on Wednesday at the funeral of the late President Ebrahim Raisi, as the clerical establishment hurried to organise an early election that could further erode its legitimacy amid growing public discontent.
articles.title: Iran Supreme Leader leads prayers at Raisi funeral as election looms

articles.author: Nerijus Adomaitis, Gwladys Fouche
articles.description: Norway will recognise an independent Palestinian state in the hope that this will help to bring peace with Israel, Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Stoere said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Norway, along with Ireland and Spain, to recognise Palestinian state

articles.author: Kokkai Ng, Joseph Campbell
articles.description: More than 140 passengers and crew from a Singapore Airlines flight hit by heavy turbulence that left dozens injured and one dead finally reached Singapore on a relief flight Wednesday morning after an emergency landing in Bangkok.
articles.title: Shaken passengers arrive in Singapore after deadly turbulence-stricken flight

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Protesters and a thousand French police reinforcements were playing a "game of cat and mouse" in New Caledonia, an independence group said on Wednesday, ahead of the arrival of France's President Emmanuel Macron after the worst riots in 40 years.
articles.title: New Caledonia protesters, police spar ahead of Macron visit

articles.author: Vivian Sequera
articles.description: Venezuela's opposition is carrying out an unusual presidential campaign starring two major figures, as primary winner Maria Corina Machado - who is barred from holding office - campaigns on behalf of her replacement, the previously low-profile Edmundo Gonzalez.
articles.title: Venezuela opposition tugs on heartstrings in unusual presidential campaign

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia's top arms control diplomat on Wednesday dismissed as fake news an assertion by the United States that Russia had launched a weapon into low-Earth orbit that was capable of inspecting and attacking other satellites.
articles.title: Russia dismisses U.S. claim that Moscow put an anti-satellite weapon in space

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chad's prime minister and opposition leader Succes Masra has tendered his resignation after interim President Mahamat Idriss Deby was confirmed as a winner of the May 6 presidential election, Masra said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Chad's PM Masra resigns after disputed election, Deby confirmed winner

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Jurors hearing the first-ever criminal trial of a former U.S. president could render their verdict in Donald Trump's hush money case as soon as next week, with potentially big implications for the 2024 White House race.
articles.title: Trump's hush money trial: how would a verdict affect the 2024 election?
